Over time, ZDoom has come to support many different music formats, which you can use in your mods. The following list is mostly a superset of the [[sound format]]s, since some of these formats are supported only for music playback.
== Midi-based formats == These formats are read by ZDoom, converted if needed to standard MIDI format, and played by one of the available [[software synthesizers]]. {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! File Extension ! Description |- | [[HMI]] | Human Machine Interface MIDI variant |- | [[HMP]] | Human Machine Interface MIDI variant |- | [[MIDI|MID/MIDI/SMF]] | Standard MIDI File format |- | [[MUS]] | Doom music |- | [[XMI]] | {{wp|Miles_Sound_System|MSS}} MIDI variant |}
== Streamed formats == These formats are read and played by the [[OpenAL]] sound backend. {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! File Extension ! Description |- | MP2 | MPEG I/II Layer 2 |- | MP3 | MPEG I/II Layer 3 |- | OGG † | Ogg Vorbis (Ogg FLAC is not supported) |- | Opus | Opus file format |- | WAV | Wave Audio |- | FLAC † | Free Lossless Audio Codec |- | WMA | Windows Media Audio ('''Win32 only''') |- | VAG | PS2/PSP Audio |- | AIFF | Audio Interchange File Format |} †: These formats support using [[audio loop]]s.
== OPL (AdLib) formats == These formats are read by ZDoom's [[OPL emulator]]. {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! File Extension ! Description |- | [[DRO]] | DOSBox Raw OPL v1 or v2 |- | [[IMF]] | Apogee Adlib Music |- | [[RAW]] | RDosPlay RAW OPL |} Note: Some IMF files don't work unless given a header, or converted to RAW, see "[[using OPL music in ZDoom]]" for more details and a tutorial.
== Module formats == These formats are read and played by a [[tracker module]], namely [[foo_DUMB]] and [[libxmp]]. {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! File Extension ! Description |- | MOD | Sound/Pro/Noisetracker Module |- | S3M | ScreamTracker 3 Module |- | XM | FastTracker 2 Module |- | IT | Impulse Tracker Module |- | STM | Old ScreamTracker Module |- | 669 | Composer 669 |- | PTM | Poly Tracker |- | PSM | Protracker Studio |- | MTM | MultiTracker |- | AMF | Asylum Music Format |- | OKT | Oktalyzer |- | DSM | DSIK Internal Format |- | RIFF AM/AMFF | Galaxy Sound System |- | UMX {{new|4.13.0}} | Unreal Engine 1.x |} '''Note for UMX files:''' Non-tracker formats are not supported.
== Emulated formats == These formats are read and played by the ZDoom's internal [[Game Music Emu]] library. {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! File Extension ! Description |- | AY | ZX Spectrum/Amstrad CPC |- | GBS | Nintendo Game Boy |- | GYM | Sega Genesis/Mega Drive |- | HES | NEC TurboGrafx-16/PC Engine |- | KSS | MSX Home Computer/other Z80 systems (No FM) |- | NSF/NSFE | Nintendo Entertainment System/Famicom |- | SAP | Atari systems using POKEY sound chip |- | SPC | Super Nintendo Entertainment System/Super Famicom |- | VGM/VGZ | Sega Master System/Mark III, Sega Genesis/Mega Drive, BBC Micro |} '''Note for multi-track files:''' In [[MAPINFO]], append a colon plus the track number to the song name(e.g. "D_NSFSNG:5"). For [[ACS]], use the second parameter (order) of [[SetMusic]] and [[LocalSetMusic]]. For the {{c|{{CCMD|D|changemus}}}} console command, add the track number as another argument after the song name.
==External Links== There are quite a few archives on the web that keep all sorts of music from various systems, in the formats listed above. * [http://asma.atari.org/ ASMA] - Atari SAP Music Archive * [http://www.mirsoft.info/ Mirsoft] - MIDI, modules, and information * [http://modarchive.org/ The Mod Archive] - Tracker module repository, mostly MOD, IT, S3M, and XM * [ftp://ftp.modland.com/pub/modules/ Modland FTP] - Repository of Adlib, emulated, and tracker module files, sorted by system, format, author, and game * [http://www.worldofspectrum.org/projectay/ Project AY] - Amstrad CPC and ZX Spectrum song archive * [http://project2612.org/ Project 2612] - Sega Master System and Genesis/Megadrive song archive * [http://snesmusic.org/v2/ SNESmusic.org] - Super NES / Super Famicom (SPC) music * [http://vgmusic.com/ Video Game Music Archive] - MIDI covers of video game songs * [http://www.vgmpf.com/Wiki/index.php?title=Main_Page Videogame Music Preservation Foundation] - Information and archive, various formats * [http://www.zophar.net/music.html Zophar's Domain] - GBS, HES, KSS, NSF, and SPC archive, among other formats [[Category:Data formats]][[Category:Audio formats|*]]
